{"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01UGNtiCinGadCq3j7xVJs4L","type":"tool_result","content":"     1→# Salvage & Tinkering System - Progressive Automation Design
     2→
     3→## Core Philosophy: Manual → Semi-Auto → Full Automation
     4→
     5→The system follows the proven idle game pattern of starting with satisfying manual actions that gradually unlock automation, making each automation upgrade feel like a meaningful achievement rather than removing gameplay.
     6→
     7→## Progression Phases Overview
     8→
     9→### Phase 1: Manual Crafting (Levels 1-10)
    10→- **Player Action**: Click each item to salvage
    11→- **Satisfaction**: Direct cause-and-effect, learning materials
    12→- **Goal**: Understand the system, feel the rewards
    13→
    14→### Phase 2: Assisted Automation (Levels 11-25)
    15→- **Player Action**: Batch processing, queue management
    16→- **Satisfaction**: Efficiency gains, strategic choices
    17→- **Goal**: Optimize throughput, unlock auto-features
    18→
    19→### Phase 3: Full Automation (Levels 26+)
    20→- **Player Action**: Strategic settings, prestige decisions
    21→- **Satisfaction**: Big number watching, optimization
    22→- **Goal**: Perfect the machine, push boundaries
    23→
    24→## Detailed Phase Breakdown
    25→
    26→### Phase 1: Manual Crafting (Tutorial → Level 10)
    27→**"Every Click Matters"**
    28→
    29→#### Salvaging Mechanics
    30→```
    31→Player Flow:
    32→1. Click item in inventory → Salvage animation (0.5 sec)
    33→2. Materials burst out → Collect by clicking or auto-collect after 2 sec
    34→3. Materials add to counter with satisfying number popup
    35→4. Empty slot ready for next item
    36→```
    37→
    38→**Early Satisfaction Loops:**
    39→- Each click produces visible materials
    40→- Different items produce different colored particles
    41→- Rare materials create screen flash and special sound
    42→- Material counter grows with each action
    43→
    44→#### Tinkering Introduction
    45→```
    46→Manual Process:
    47→1. Drag materials to equipment piece
    48→2. Hold button to "channel" upgrade (2 seconds)
    49→3. Success animation shows +1 on item
    50→4. Power level increases visibly
    51→```
    52→
    53→**No Failure at This Stage:**
    54→- 100% success rate to build confidence
    55→- Cost increases but always achievable
    56→- Clear progress per action
    57→
    58→#### First Automation Unlocks
    59→**Level 5: Auto-Collect**
    60→- Materials automatically fly to inventory after 0.5 seconds
    61→- Feels like first "upgrade" to efficiency
    62→
    63→**Level 8: Batch Select**
    64→- Shift-click to select multiple items
    65→- "Salvage All Selected" button appears
    66→- Still manual but more efficient
    67→
    68→**Level 10: The Assistant**
    69→- Unlock first automation: "Salvage Assistant"
    70→- Salvages 1 item every 3 seconds
    71→- Player can still click to go faster
    72→- Major milestone celebration
    73→
    74→### Phase 2: Assisted Automation (Levels 11-25)
    75→**"Building Your Empire"**
    76→
    77→#### Automation Upgrades (Unlock Tree)
    78→
    79→**Salvage Automation Line:**
    80→```
    81→Level 11: Basic Assistant (1 item/3 sec)
    82→    ↓
    83→Level 13: Skilled Assistant (1 item/2 sec)
    84→    ↓
    85→Level 15: Expert Assistant (1 item/1 sec)
    86→    ↓
    87→Level 18: Salvage Team (3 items/sec)
    88→    ↓
    89→Level 22: Salvage Factory (10 items/sec)
    90→```
    91→
    92→**Tinkering Automation Line:**
    93→```
    94→Level 12: Auto-Tinker Toggle
    95→- Automatically uses materials when available
    96→- Player sets target item
    97→- Visual progress bar fills
    98→
    99→Level 16: Priority System
   100→- Set priority order for equipment
   101→- Materials distributed automatically
   102→- Can override with manual tinkering
   103→
   104→Level 20: Smart Tinkering
   105→- AI suggests optimal distribution
   106→- One-click to accept suggestion
   107→- Learn patterns from player choices
   108→```
   109→
   110→#### Hybrid Gameplay
   111→**Player Still Actively Engaged:**
   112→- **Click Bonuses**: Manual clicks 2x faster than automation
   113→- **Combo System**: Click 10 items quickly for speed burst
   114→- **Critical Clicks**: 5% chance for 5x materials on manual salvage
   115→- **Active Tinkering**: Manual tinkering 50% cheaper than auto
   116→
   117→**Strategic Decisions:**
   118→- Which automation to upgrade next
   119→- When to manual boost vs idle
   120→- Resource allocation between paths
   121→- Setting automation priorities
   122→
   123→#### New Systems Introduced
   124→**Material Refinement (Level 15):**
   125→- Combine 3 common → 1 rare (manual at first)
   126→- Unlocks auto-refiner at Level 20
   127→
   128→**Salvage Filters (Level 18):**
   129→- Set rules: "Auto-salvage commons"
   130→- Keep control over valuable items
   131→- Gradually trust the system more
   132→
   133→### Phase 3: Full Automation (Level 26+)
   134→**"Optimization Paradise"**
   135→
   136→#### Complete Automation Unlocks
   137→
   138→**Level 26: Master Salvager**
   139→- Process up to 100 items/second
   140→- Queue holds 10,000 items
   141→- Offline progression activated
   142→- Materials accumulate while away
   143→
   144→**Level 30: Grand Tinkermaster**
   145→- Manages all equipment simultaneously
   146→- Predictive AI enhancement
   147→- Perfect material distribution
   148→- No waste guarantee
   149→
   150→#### Advanced Systems
   151→
   152→**Prestige Salvaging (Level 35):**
   153→```
   154→Every 1000 items salvaged:
   155→- Choose 1 of 3 bonuses:
   156→  * +10% all materials for 1 hour
   157→  * Next 100 salvages guaranteed rare
   158→  * Double tinkering speed for 30 min
   159→```
   160→
   161→**Forge Mastery (Level 40):**
   162→- Automated forge cycles every 2 hours
   163→- Player chooses focus before each cycle
   164→- Results apply across all equipment
   165→- Massive power spikes
   166→
   167→**The Clicking Endgame:**
   168→- **God Click**: Manual click processes 1000 items instantly (1hr cooldown)
   169→- **Perfect Salvage**: Manual salvage has 50% chance for legendary materials
   170→- **Master's Touch**: Manual tinkering can exceed normal limits
   171→- Clicking remains relevant but optional
   172→
   173→## UI Evolution Through Phases
   174→
   175→### Phase 1 UI: Hands-On Interface
   176→```
   177→[Inventory Grid - Click each item]
   178→[↓ Salvage ↓]
   179→[Material Counters: Common: 12  Rare: 2]
   180→[Equipment Slots - Drag materials here]
   181→```
   182→
   183→### Phase 2 UI: Management Dashboard
   184→```
   185→[Auto-Salvage: ON] [Speed: 3/sec] [Queue: 47]
   186→[==========Progress Bar==========]
   187→Materials: Common: 1,234 | Rare: 156 | Epic: 12
   188→[Equipment Grid with Auto-Priorities]
   189→[Upgrade Automation Tree]
   190→```
   191→
   192→### Phase 3 UI: Command Center
   193→```
   194→[Salvage Factory: 47.3/sec] [Queue: 8,471] [Efficiency: 94%]
   195→[Material Flows: →→→ Streaming Numbers →→→]
   196→[Equipment Power: 45,831 (+1,247/hour)]
   197→[Strategic Controls] [Prestige Options] [Statistics]
   198→```
   199→
   200→## Progression Pacing
   201→
   202→### Time to Automation Milestones
   203→- **First Auto-Salvage**: 15-20 minutes (Level 10)
   204→- **Meaningful Automation**: 1-2 hours (Level 15)
   205→- **Mostly Automated**: 5-8 hours (Level 25)
   206→- **Full Automation**: 15-20 hours (Level 30)
   207→- **Optimization Phase**: 20+ hours (Level 35+)
   208→
   209→### Why This Works
   210→1. **Investment Before Automation**: Players understand and value what they're automating
   211→2. **Gradual Trust Building**: Slowly hand over control as confidence grows
   212→3. **Maintained Agency**: Can always click for bonuses/speed
   213→4. **Clear Progression**: Each automation feels earned and impactful
   214→5. **Depth Revelation**: Complexity appears just as previous layer becomes routine
   215→
   216→## Monetization Along the Journey
   217→
   218→### Phase 1 Monetization (Manual Phase)
   219→- **Energy Boosts**: More clicks per minute
   220→- **Starter Packs**: Initial materials
   221→- **Salvage Hammer**: +50% materials for 1 hour
   222→
   223→### Phase 2 Monetization (Hybrid Phase)
   224→- **Automation Accelerator**: Unlock automations 5 levels early
   225→- **Queue Expander**: Hold 2x more items
   226→- **Speed Demons**: Temporary 2x automation speed
   227→
   228→### Phase 3 Monetization (Auto Phase)
   229→- **Offline Maximizer**: 2x offline gains
   230→- **Perfect Settings**: AI optimization unlocked
   231→- **Prestige Tokens**: Extra prestige choices
   232→
   233→## Engagement Mechanics per Phase
   234→
   235→### Phase 1: Direct Engagement
   236→- **Satisfaction**: Every click = immediate reward
   237→- **Learning**: Discovering which items give best materials
   238→- **Goals**: "Just need 50 more materials for upgrade"
   239→
   240→### Phase 2: Strategic Engagement
   241→- **Satisfaction**: Watching efficiency improve
   242→- **Planning**: Choosing upgrade paths
   243→- **Goals**: "Unlock the next automation tier"
   244→
   245→### Phase 3: Optimization Engagement
   246→- **Satisfaction**: Big numbers going up
   247→- **Perfection**: Finding optimal settings
   248→- **Goals**: "Reach 1 million power level"
   249→
   250→## Success Metrics by Phase
   251→
   252→### Phase 1 Success Indicators
   253→- 80% of players salvage 100 items manually
   254→- 90% successfully complete first tinkering
   255→- Average session: 10-15 minutes
   256→
   257→### Phase 2 Success Indicators
   258→- 70% unlock first automation
   259→- 60% use both manual and auto in same session
   260→- Average session: 20-30 minutes
   261→
   262→### Phase 3 Success Indicators
   263→- 50% reach full automation
   264→- 40% engage with prestige system
   265→- 30% return daily for a month
   266→
   267→## Implementation Approach
   268→
   269→### Week 1: Manual Foundation
   270→- Clicking mechanics
   271→- Material collection
   272→- Basic tinkering
   273→- Satisfaction feedback
   274→
   275→### Week 2: Early Automation
   276→- First assistant
   277→- Automation unlocks
   278→- Hybrid gameplay
   279→- UI evolution
   280→
   281→### Week 3: Full System
   282→- Complete automation
   283→- Prestige layers
   284→- Advanced features
   285→- Optimization tools
   286→
   287→### Week 4: Polish & Balance
   288→- Pacing refinement
   289→- Monetization integration
   290→- Tutorial flow
   291→- Analytics setup
   292→
   293→## Key Design Principles
   294→
   295→1. **Respect the Click**: Manual action always has value, even in late game
   296→2. **Earned Automation**: Each automation is a reward, not a given
   297→3. **Progressive Complexity**: New systems appear as old ones become routine
   298→4. **Player Agency**: Automation assists, never replaces decision-making
   299→5. **Satisfaction First**: Every interaction produces positive feedback
   300→
   301→## Conclusion
   302→
   303→This progressive system captures the best of both worlds:
   304→- **Early Game**: The tactile satisfaction of Asheron's Call's manual crafting
   305→- **Mid Game**: The strategic depth of management games
   306→- **Late Game**: The optimization paradise of idle games
   307→
   308→Players experience the full journey from "I did this" to "I built this" to "Look what I've created," maintaining engagement through natural progression rather than forced complexity. The system teaches through action, rewards through automation, and retains through optimization - the perfect idle game progression.

    21→
    22→Create a comprehensive PRD following these specifications:
    23→
    24→### Document Structure
    25→Generate a markdown PRD with these sections in order:
    26→
    27→#### 1. Header & Metadata
    28→- Document title with feature name
    29→- Version control table (start at v1.0)
    30→- Author, date, status
    31→- Executive summary (2-3 sentences)
    32→
    33→#### 2. Problem & Opportunity
    34→- **Problem Statement**: Clear description with evidence
    35→- **User Impact**: Who's affected and how often

    48→- Include 2-3 secondary metrics (user engagement)

    50→

    54→**Story: [Title]**

    58→
    59→**Acceptance Criteria:**
    60→- [ ] Given [context], when [action], then [outcome]
    61→- [ ] [Additional criteria using Given/When/Then or rules]
    62→```
    63→
    64→#### 6. Functional Requirements
    65→Organize by feature area:
    66→- **[Feature Category]**
    67→  - Requirement 1: [Specific, measurable description]
    68→  - Requirement 2: [Specific, measurable description]
    69→

    75→- **Browser/Device Support**: [Specific requirements]
    76→
    77→#### 8. Scope Definition
    78→Following @docs/guides/lean-task-generation-guide.md - focus on deliverable features, not infrastructure:
    79→
    80→**MVP (Must Have):**
    81→- P0: [Critical user-visible feature]
    82→- P0: [Critical user-visible feature]
    83→
    84→**Nice to Have:**
    85→- P1: [Important but not critical]
    86→- P2: [Future enhancement]
    87→
    88→**Out of Scope:**
    89→- [Explicitly excluded feature]
    90→- [Future iteration item]
    91→
    92→#### 9. Dependencies & Risks
    93→| Type | Description | Owner | Mitigation | Status |
    94→Include 2-3 realistic dependencies/risks
    95→
    96→#### 10. Timeline & Milestones
    97→- Discovery & Design: [X weeks]
    98→- Development: [X weeks]
    99→- Testing & QA: [X weeks]
   100→- Launch: [Target date]
   101→
   102→Total: [X-X weeks]
   103→
   104→#### 11. Open Questions
   105→- [ ] [Question needing resolution]
   106→- [ ] [Decision to be made]
   107→
   108→#### 12. Appendix
   109→- Glossary of terms
   110→- References and links
   111→- Related documents
   112→
   113→### Quality Requirements
   114→
   115→The PRD must be:
   116→1. **Specific**: No vague terms like "easy" or "fast" - use measurable criteria
   117→2. **User-Focused**: Write from user perspective, not system perspective
   118→3. **Measurable**: Every requirement should be testable
   119→4. **Realistic**: Timeline and scope should be achievable
   120→5. **Complete**: Address all aspects including edge cases and error states

   123→- Use tables for structured data
   124→- Use checkboxes for criteria and questions
   125→- Use priority labels (P0/P1/P2) for features
   126→- Include realistic but hypothetical metrics
   127→- Keep descriptions concise (1-2 sentences max)
   128→

   131→❌ BAD: "Easy password reset functionality"
   132→
   133→✅ GOOD: "Page loads in <2 seconds for 95% of users on 4G connections"
   134→❌ BAD: "Fast page loading"
   135→
   136→## Output

   138→Generate the complete PRD and save to:
   139→- Filename: `prd_[feature_name_snake_case]_[YYYYMMDD].md`
   140→- Location: Same directory as the feature description file

{"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01XGwJGXZbM2JNLfRb1e3Wn4","type":"tool_result","content":"     1→# Lean Task Generation Guide
     2→
     3→## Purpose
     4→This guide defines how to generate implementation tasks that follow lean development principles. Every task must deliver working functionality, with infrastructure emerging naturally from feature needs.
     5→
     6→## Core Principles
     7→
     8→### 1. No Infrastructure-Only Tasks
     9→**❌ BAD**: "Set up project folder structure"
    10→**✅ GOOD**: "Implement tap-to-damage feature (creating services/DamageCalculator.ts as needed)"
    11→
    12→### 2. Start with Simplest Working Feature
    13→The first task must deliver user-visible functionality using existing files where possible.
    14→
    15→**❌ BAD First Task**:
    16→```
    17→Task 1.1: Initialize Project Repository
    18→- Create folder structure
    19→- Install dependencies
    20→- Configure tools
    21→```
    22→
    23→**✅ GOOD First Task**:
    24→```
    25→Task 1.1: Basic Tap-to-Damage with TDD
    26→- Write failing test in App.test.tsx
    27→- Modify existing App.tsx to pass test
    28→- User can tap enemy to deal damage
    29→```
    30→
    31→### 3. Just-In-Time Everything
    32→- **Dependencies**: Install only when first used in a feature
    33→- **Folders**: Create only when adding first file
    34→- **Configuration**: Setup only when feature needs it
    35→- **Abstractions**: Extract only when duplication appears
    36→
    37→### 4. Every Task Delivers Functionality

### Executive Summary
The Salvage & Tinkering Progressive Automation System introduces a three-phase progression model that transforms manual item salvaging and equipment upgrading into an increasingly automated idle game experience. Players start with satisfying manual clicks that teach system mechanics, gradually unlock automation features as rewards for progression, and ultimately build an optimization-focused endgame where strategic decisions replace manual actions. This feature targets the core idle/incremental game audience while providing engagement hooks for both active clickers and passive players.

---

## Problem & Opportunity

### Problem Statement
Current idle game implementations face a critical engagement paradox: introducing automation too early removes player agency and makes early gameplay feel hollow, while withholding automation too long frustrates players who expect idle mechanics. Players abandon games that feel like "work simulators" without meaningful progression rewards, yet also quit games where automation makes their actions feel meaningless from the start. Evidence from player feedback across the idle game genre shows 40-60% drop-off in the first hour when manual actions lack purpose or automation lacks progression.

### User Impact
**Primary Users**: Idle/incremental game players who enjoy progression systems (85% of target audience)
- **Casual Players (60%)**: Need satisfying manual actions that transition smoothly to idle play over 1-3 hours
- **Active Grinders (25%)**: Want hybrid manual+auto gameplay where clicking remains valuable even at max level
- **Optimization Players (15%)**: Seek complex late-game systems with strategic depth

**Frequency**: Daily engagement with 3-5 session peaks during progression phases

### Business Impact
**Cost of Not Solving**:
- 45% estimated first-hour churn without satisfying manual introduction
- 30% mid-game abandonment without clear automation progression
- 60% reduced long-term retention without endgame optimization systems
- Lost monetization opportunities at each progression phase (estimated $12-18 ARPPU reduction)

### Evidence
Based on genre analysis and hypothetical user testing:
- 78% of successful idle games introduce first automation within 15-30 minutes of gameplay
- Manual bonuses maintain 40% click engagement in automation-heavy games
- Prestige/optimization systems extend average playtime by 300% (from 5 hours to 20+ hours)
- Three-tier progression models show 2.5x better retention than binary manual-to-auto systems

---

## Solution Overview

### Approach
Implement a three-phase progression system where salvaging (breaking down items for materials) and tinkering (upgrading equipment) evolve from purely manual operations through hybrid assisted automation to fully automated optimization gameplay. Each phase introduces new mechanics and UI paradigms at precisely calibrated progression milestones, ensuring players understand and value each system before automation removes direct interaction.

**Phase 1 (Levels 1-10)**: Manual actions with instant feedback - players click to salvage items and drag materials to upgrade equipment with 100% success rates and satisfying visual/audio feedback.

**Phase 2 (Levels 11-25)**: Hybrid gameplay unlocking automation assistants while maintaining manual bonuses (2x speed, critical clicks, combo chains) - players balance automated collection with active clicking for optimal efficiency.

**Phase 3 (Levels 26+)**: Full automation with strategic optimization - players configure automation rules, manage prestige bonuses, and make high-level decisions while watching numbers scale exponentially.

### Value Proposition
Players experience the complete psychological journey from "I did this with my own hands" (mastery) to "I built this efficient machine" (achievement) to "Look at this empire I've created" (status). Each automation unlock feels like a meaningful progression reward rather than a feature gate, maintaining engagement through natural complexity escalation rather than artificial grind.

### Key Differentiators
- **Earned Automation Philosophy**: Every automation feature is unlocked through progression, making automation feel like achievement rather than baseline expectation
- **Persistent Manual Value**: Clicking provides tangible bonuses (2x speed, critical hits, combo multipliers) even at maximum automation levels
- **Three-Phase UI Evolution**: Interface transforms from tactile interaction grid to management dashboard to strategic command center
- **Monetization Aligned to Progression**: Each phase offers phase-appropriate purchases (energy boosts → automation accelerators → optimization tools)

## User Stories & Requirements

### Story 1: First Manual Salvage Experience
**As a** new player exploring the game
**I want to** click items to salvage them with immediate visual/audio feedback
**So that I can** understand the material system and feel satisfaction from direct actions

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I tap an item in inventory, when the salvage animation completes (0.5s), then materials burst out with particle effects matching material rarity
- [ ] Given materials are on screen, when 0.5s passes, then materials automatically fly to inventory with satisfying collection sound
- [ ] Given I salvage a rare item, when materials appear, then screen flashes and special audio plays
- [ ] Given I collect materials, when they reach my inventory, then counter updates with popup number animation (+12 Common, +2 Rare)

### Story 2: Manual Tinkering Introduction
**As a** player with collected materials
**I want to** manually upgrade my equipment with guaranteed success
**So that I can** see immediate power gains and understand the tinkering mechanics

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I drag materials to equipment slot, when I hold the "channel" button for 2 seconds, then upgrade animation plays and item shows +1
- [ ] Given I complete tinkering, when animation finishes, then power level increases visibly in character stats
- [ ] Given I'm in Phase 1 (Level 1-10), when I tinker any item, then success rate is 100% (no failures)
- [ ] Given each successful tinker, when upgrade applies, then material cost increases but remains achievable with current salvage rates

### Story 3: First Automation Unlock
**As a** player reaching Level 10
**I want to** unlock the Salvage Assistant with celebration
**So that I can** feel meaningful progression and experience my first automation reward

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I reach Level 10, when I level up, then major celebration modal appears announcing "Salvage Assistant Unlocked!"
- [ ] Given I enable the assistant, when it's active, then it automatically salvages 1 item every 3 seconds from my inventory queue
- [ ] Given the assistant is running, when I manually click to salvage, then I can still go faster than automation (manual is immediate, auto is 3s delay)
- [ ] Given first automation unlocks, when I view the UI, then new "Automation" panel appears showing assistant status and queue

### Story 4: Hybrid Gameplay Balance
**As a** mid-level player (11-25)
**I want to** combine automated salvaging with manual clicking for bonuses
**So that I can** optimize my resource generation while maintaining active engagement

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I manually click to salvage, when salvage completes, then I get 2x materials compared to automated salvage
- [ ] Given I manually click 10 items within 5 seconds, when 10th click completes, then "Combo Burst!" activates giving 3x speed for 10 seconds
- [ ] Given I manually salvage, when salvage completes, then 5% chance for "Critical Salvage!" yielding 5x materials
- [ ] Given I have automation running, when I view stats, then I can see split between auto-generated vs manual-generated materials

### Story 5: Automation Priority Configuration
**As a** player managing multiple automation systems
**I want to** set priorities and filters for what gets automated
**So that I can** control the system while still benefiting from automation

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I unlock Salvage Filters (Level 18), when I configure settings, then I can set rules like "Auto-salvage Common and Uncommon only"
- [ ] Given I unlock Auto-Tinker (Level 12), when I activate it, then I can select target equipment piece for material allocation
- [ ] Given I unlock Priority System (Level 16), when I set equipment priorities (1-5), then materials automatically distribute to highest priority first
- [ ] Given any automation is active, when I manually interact, then manual action always overrides automation immediately

### Story 6: Full Automation & Optimization
**As a** end-game player (Level 26+)
**I want to** configure complete automation and make strategic optimization decisions
**So that I can** focus on high-level planning while watching exponential number growth

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I reach Level 26, when Master Salvager unlocks, then system processes up to 100 items/second with 10,000 item queue capacity
- [ ] Given I unlock offline progression, when I close the app for 1 hour, then on return I receive accumulated materials (capped at 4 hours max)
- [ ] Given I reach prestige milestone (1000 salvages), when milestone hits, then I choose 1 of 3 strategic bonuses affecting next hour of play
- [ ] Given I unlock Smart Tinkering AI (Level 20), when I click "Optimize," then AI suggests material distribution based on my playstyle patterns

### Story 7: Endgame Manual Bonuses
**As a** max-level player with full automation
**I want to** still have powerful reasons to manually click
**So that I can** feel my actions matter even in the idle endgame

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Given I unlock God Click (Level 35), when I use it, then 1000 items process instantly with 1-hour cooldown
- [ ] Given I manually salvage at max level, when salvage completes, then 50% chance for legendary materials (unavailable through automation)
- [ ] Given I manually tinker at max level, when successful, then upgrades can exceed normal automation limits (+2 instead of +1)
- [ ] Given I'm actively playing, when I switch between manual and auto, then UI clearly shows which bonuses are active

## Functional Requirements

### Salvaging System
- **Manual Salvage Mechanics**
  - Tap interaction triggers 0.5-second animation with item-specific visual effects
  - Material particles spawn with color-coded rarities (grey=common, blue=rare, purple=epic, gold=legendary)
  - Auto-collection activates after 0.5 seconds with magnetic pull animation and sound effect
  - Salvage speed: Instant on click (no cooldown for manual clicks in Phase 1)

- **Automated Salvage Progression**
  - Level 10: Basic Assistant (1 item/3 seconds)
  - Level 13: Skilled Assistant (1 item/2 seconds)
  - Level 15: Expert Assistant (1 item/1 second)
  - Level 18: Salvage Team (3 items/second)
  - Level 22: Salvage Factory (10 items/second)
  - Level 26: Master Salvager (up to 100 items/second with queue system)

- **Manual Bonuses & Engagement**
  - Manual clicks yield 2x materials compared to automation
  - Combo system: 10 manual salvages within 5 seconds triggers 3x speed burst for 10 seconds
  - Critical clicks: 5% chance on manual salvage for 5x material yield
  - Statistics tracking: Display manual vs automated contribution percentages

### Tinkering System
- **Manual Tinkering Process**
  - Drag materials to equipment slot (visual validation of sufficient materials)
  - Hold-to-channel button (2-second press with progress circle)
  - Success animation shows +1 upgrade with power level increase notification
  - Phase 1 success rate: 100% guaranteed (no failures until Phase 2)
  - Cost scaling: Each upgrade increases material requirement by 1.5x

- **Automated Tinkering Progression**
  - Level 12: Auto-Tinker Toggle (player selects target equipment, system auto-applies materials)
  - Level 16: Priority System (rank equipment 1-5, materials distribute to high priority first)
  - Level 20: Smart Tinkering (AI suggests optimal distribution based on player goals)
  - Level 30: Grand Tinkermaster (manages all equipment simultaneously with zero waste)

- **Manual Tinkering Advantages**
  - Manual tinkering costs 50% fewer materials than automated tinkering
  - Manual tinkering at high levels can exceed +1 per action (potential +2 or +3)
  - Direct control over which equipment receives upgrades regardless of automation settings

### Material System
- **Material Types & Collection**
  - Common (grey): 70% drop rate, basic upgrade resource
  - Rare (blue): 25% drop rate, intermediate upgrade resource
  - Epic (purple): 4% drop rate, advanced upgrade resource
  - Legendary (gold): 1% drop rate (manual-only at 50% chance endgame), prestige resource

- **Material Refinement** (unlocks Level 15)
  - Manual refinement: Combine 3 common → 1 rare (button press with confirmation)
  - Auto-refiner (Level 20): Automatically refines excess commons to rares based on threshold settings
  - Refinement ratios: 3:1 common→rare, 5:1 rare→epic, 10:1 epic→legendary

- **Material Storage & Display**
  - Real-time counter with animated number popups on collection
  - Phase 1 display: Simple counters (Common: 12, Rare: 2)
  - Phase 2 display: Bar graphs showing generation rates
  - Phase 3 display: Streaming numbers with per-second rates and projections

### Automation Controls
- **Queue Management**
  - Visual queue showing next 20 items to be salvaged
  - Drag-to-reorder within queue (manual priority override)
  - "Skip" and "Remove" buttons for individual queue items
  - Queue capacity scales with level: 100 (L10) → 1,000 (L20) → 10,000 (L26)

- **Filter & Rule System** (unlocks Level 18)
  - Toggle filters: "Auto-salvage Commons," "Auto-salvage Rares," etc.
  - Whitelist system: Mark specific items to never auto-salvage
  - Smart filters: "Auto-salvage duplicates," "Keep best of each type"
  - Filter preview mode showing what would be salvaged before enabling

- **Offline Progression** (unlocks Level 26)
  - Tracks time away from app (maximum 4 hours counted)
  - Calculates materials generated based on automation rates at time of closing
  - Welcome-back modal showing accumulated resources
  - "2x Offline Gains" available as premium feature

### Prestige & Advanced Systems
- **Prestige Salvaging** (unlocks Level 35)
  - Milestone triggers every 1,000 items salvaged
  - Three-choice bonus modal: +10% all materials (1hr) | Next 100 guaranteed rare | 2x tinker speed (30min)
  - Prestige point accumulation for permanent upgrades
  - Visual prestige badge showing total prestiges completed

- **Forge Mastery** (unlocks Level 40)
  - Automated 2-hour forge cycles
  - Pre-cycle focus selection: Power focus, Speed focus, or Efficiency focus
  - Cycle completion applies multipliers across all equipment
  - Forge upgrade tree using prestige points

- **Endgame God Powers**
  - God Click (1-hour cooldown): Process 1,000 items instantly
  - Perfect Salvage: 50% chance for legendary materials on manual salvage
  - Master's Touch: Manual tinkering can hit +2 or +3 upgrades

### Executive Summary
The Salvage & Tinkering Progressive Automation System introduces a three-phase progression model that transforms manual item salvaging and equipment upgrading into an increasingly automated idle game experience. Players start with satisfying manual clicks that teach system mechanics, gradually unlock automation features as rewards for progression, and ultimately build an optimization-focused endgame where strategic decisions replace manual actions. This feature targets the core idle/incremental game audience while providing engagement hooks for both active clickers and passive players.

---

## Problem & Opportunity

### Problem Statement
Current idle game implementations face a critical engagement paradox: introducing automation too early removes player agency and makes early gameplay feel hollow, while withholding automation too long frustrates players who expect idle mechanics. Players abandon games that feel like "work simulators" without meaningful progression rewards, yet also quit games where automation makes their actions feel meaningless from the start. Evidence from player feedback across the idle game genre shows 40-60% drop-off in the first hour when manual actions lack purpose or automation lacks progression.

### User Impact
**Primary Users**: Idle/incremental game players who enjoy progression systems (85% of target audience)
- **Casual Players (60%)**: Need satisfying manual actions that transition smoothly to idle play over 1-3 hours
- **Active Grinders (25%)**: Want hybrid manual+auto gameplay where clicking remains valuable even at max level
- **Optimization Players (15%)**: Seek complex late-game systems with strategic depth

**Frequency**: Daily engagement with 3-5 session peaks during progression phases

### Business Impact
**Cost of Not Solving**:
- 45% estimated first-hour churn without satisfying manual introduction
- 30% mid-game abandonment without clear automation progression
- 60% reduced long-term retention without endgame optimization systems
- Lost monetization opportunities at each progression phase (estimated $12-18 ARPPU reduction)

### Evidence
Based on genre analysis and hypothetical user testing:
- 78% of successful idle games introduce first automation within 15-30 minutes of gameplay
- Manual bonuses maintain 40% click engagement in automation-heavy games
- Prestige/optimization systems extend average playtime by 300% (from 5 hours to 20+ hours)
- Three-tier progression models show 2.5x better retention than binary manual-to-auto systems

---

## Solution Overview

### Approach
Implement a three-phase progression system where salvaging (breaking down items for materials) and tinkering (upgrading equipment) evolve from purely manual operations through hybrid assisted automation to fully automated optimization gameplay. Each phase introduces new mechanics and UI paradigms at precisely calibrated progression milestones, ensuring players understand and value each system before automation removes direct interaction.

**Phase 1 (Levels 1-10)**: Manual actions with instant feedback - players click to salvage items and drag materials to upgrade equipment with 100% success rates and satisfying visual/audio feedback.

**Phase 2 (Levels 11-25)**: Hybrid gameplay unlocking automation assistants while maintaining manual bonuses (2x speed, critical clicks, combo chains) - players balance automated collection with active clicking for optimal efficiency.

**Phase 3 (Levels 26+)**: Full automation with strategic optimization - players configure automation rules, manage prestige bonuses, and make high-level decisions while watching numbers scale exponentially.

### Value Proposition
Players experience the complete psychological journey from "I did this with my own hands" (mastery) to "I built this efficient machine" (achievement) to "Look at this empire I've created" (status). Each automation unlock feels like a meaningful progression reward rather than a feature gate, maintaining engagement through natural complexity escalation rather than artificial grind.

### Key Differentiators
- **Earned Automation Philosophy**: Every automation feature is unlocked through progression, making automation feel like achievement rather than baseline expectation
- **Persistent Manual Value**: Clicking provides tangible bonuses (2x speed, critical hits, combo multipliers) even at maximum automation levels
- **Three-Phase UI Evolution**: Interface transforms from tactile interaction grid to management dashboard to strategic command center
- **Monetization Aligned to Progression**: Each phase offers phase-appropriate purchases (energy boosts → automation accelerators → optimization tools)

  - Manual clicks yield 2x materials compared to automation
  - Combo system: 10 manual salvages within 5 seconds triggers 3x speed burst for 10 seconds
  - Critical clicks: 5% chance on manual salvage for 5x material yield
  - Statistics tracking: Display manual vs automated contribution percentages

- **Manual Tinkering Process**
  - Drag materials to equipment slot (visual validation of sufficient materials)
  - Hold-to-channel button (2-second press with progress circle)
  - Success animation shows +1 upgrade with power level increase notification
  - Phase 1 success rate: 100% guaranteed (no failures until Phase 2)

  - Manual tinkering costs 50% fewer materials than automated tinkering
  - Manual tinkering at high levels can exceed +1 per action (potential +2 or +3)
  - Direct control over which equipment receives upgrades regardless of automation settings

  - Common (grey): 70% drop rate, basic upgrade resource

| **Combo System** | Reward for rapid manual actions (10 clicks in 5 seconds) |

| **Queue** | Ordered list of items waiting to be processed by automation |
